name: Peer Interaction Breakthrough
description: Free play session in the play area. Child_2, who typically engages in solitary play, is playing with blocks alone. Child_4 approaches and watches. The teacher notices and provides gentle facilitation, suggesting they could build together. Child_2 initially ignores child_4, but after the teacher models sharing a block, child_2 hands a block to child_4. They engage in brief parallel play that evolves into cooperative building. Child_2 makes eye contact twice and says a few words. This is a significant social breakthrough for child_2.

focus_children.description: Typically solitary, minimal verbal output, rarely initiates peer interaction
Socially motivated, often approaches peers, persistent

key_moments.description: Child_4 approaches child_2 who is playing alone
Child_2 shares a block - first sharing behavior
Cooperative play emerges with eye contact
